intro: Lobostemon alopecuroideus, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vine-like species. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing as a herbaceous annual or perennial. Its unique foliage and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
